results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7858c95886-w44l4], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs Pod/mysql-7858c95886-w44l4`. 3. Verify readiness probe configuration. 4. Ensure the pod is healthy and running.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-fb6795cb7-rhvd2], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not receiving traffic because the pod 'wordpress-fb6795cb7-rhvd2' is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Describe pod for details: `kubectl describe pod wordpress-fb6795cb7-rhvd2`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues.
4. Fix any configuration errors.
5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/mysql-7858c95886-w44l4
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-fb6795cb7-rhvd2
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.
